title: Ameloblastic Carcinoma: Demographics and Age Distribution
short_description: Clinical document describing the demographic characteristics and age distribution of ameloblastic carcinoma patients.
long_description: This clinical research document provides epidemiological information about ameloblastic carcinoma, a rare malignant odontogenic tumor. The document details the demographic distribution of this condition, noting equal prevalence between males and females and describing the age range of affected individuals. While the tumor can occur at any age including in pediatric populations, the document establishes that the mean age of diagnosis is approximately 30 years old, providing important baseline demographic data for clinical understanding and research purposes.
